3.48 
Compulsory participation of guardianship authorities In proceedings for the annulment of a marriage where one or both spouses are minors or have been declared by a court decision to be incapacitated in this area or to have limited capacity in this area, the guardianship authorities or the State authority for the protection of the rights of the child must be present to give an opinion on whether annulment of the marriage will not affect the rights and interests of these persons and their children, unless the proceedings are brought before the courts on the basis of an action brought by the State authority for the protection of children.
